definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: Cans looking at prime minister to grasp a cordage, is plucked at them up.
sentences.chinese: 只能看着相國抓着繩子，被他們拉上去。

sentences.english: After Duan Siying succeeded to the throne, he began to scramble for the power and profit with the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 而段思英繼位後，就開始和相國董迦羅爭奪權利。

sentences.english: In ancient times, there was a prime minister named Shang Yang in the State of Qin. He was held in high regard by the King.
sentences.chinese: 古時候秦國有個相國叫商鞅，秦王非常器重他。

sentences.english: Hong Neung taught Cheung Sang the way to face the Ladys blaming.
sentences.chinese: 紅娘教張生應對相國夫人的責備。

sentences.english: In ancient times, a personal letter from Chu Ying Yan to the country.
sentences.chinese: 古時候，有個人從楚國的郢都寫信給燕國的相國。

definition: to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
to be in overall charge/to oversee
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
